Description: Mould-made pottery lamp with a double-convex body, a small sunken discus surrounded by a groove, and a raised base, slightly concave below and defined by a groove. The long flat-topped nozzle has a splayed end and a curved tip, and is decorated with volutes at its junction with the shoulder. On the left side of the shoulder is a dolphin. Covered with a red slip.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q596)
